newsitem.title: GERMANY: Lurgi gets Egyptian drinking water contract.
newsitem.headline: Lurgi gets Egyptian drinking water contract.

text.p: Engineering group Lurgi, a unit of Germany's Metallgesellschaft AG, said on Wednesday that its joint-venture with an Egyptian company had received a contract to build a drinking water project in Egypt.
The project involves the construction of a drinking water plant at Al Sheikh Zayed City, a Cairo satellite town.
The group said in a statement the contract for complete construction of the plant had been awarded to Lurgi's Bamag unit and its Egyptian partner The Arab Contractors Osman Ahmed Osman & Co.
Lurgi Bamag unit will take over project leadership and overall planning of the project for $40 million.
The project will produce 500,000 cubic metres of drinking water a day orginally sourced from the river Nile from mid-2000, catering for the needs of over three million people.
Lurgi said that the Egyptian government would invest around $60 million in the project. The project will also be financed by the Abu Dhabi Fund for Development.
